Given the observed state \\( z(T) \\), can we definitively ascertain whether an initial Fourier transform or its inverse was applied at any time, knowing only the outcome at \\( z(T) \\)?

Deductive certainty about the specific transformations applied is unattainable without additional data indicating the precise interventions.
